blogPosts.title: PSL 11 Expansion: Sialkot and Hyderabad Join the Ranks in Record Auction
blogPosts.excerpt: The Pakistan Super League has officially expanded to eight teams as Sialkot and Hyderabad were sold for record-breaking bids in the 2026 auction.
blogPosts.content:
A Historic Night in Islamabad

The landscape of Pakistan cricket changed forever on January 8, 2026, at the Jinnah Convention Centre. The Pakistan Super League (PSL) successfully completed its expansion from six [...]

The Big Bidders

The auction saw intense competition among ten technically qualified bidders. In a dramatic final round, the Sialkot franchise set a new league record, while ...

  • Sialkot (OZ Developers): Sold for a staggering Rs 1.85 billion, the highest bid in PSL history.
  • Hyderabad (FKS Group): Secured for Rs 1.75 billion after a fierce bidding war.

New Rivals, New Format

With the addition of these two cities, the PSL 11 (scheduled for March 26 to May 3, 2026) will feature a revamped schedule. PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi noted that the inclusion of Sia[...]

"Ten years of PSL have led us to this moment. The valuations we've seen tonight prove that the PSL is not just a cricket tournament; it is a global sporting brand that continues to[...]"
blogPosts.author: Zainab Malik

blogPosts.title: Multan Sultans: PCB Takes Control as Ali Tareen Steps Away
blogPosts.excerpt: Following the expiry of the ownership agreement, the PCB will manage Multan Sultans for the 2026 season before a planned auction in 2027.
blogPosts.content:
End of an Era for the Tareen Family

In a significant shift for the 2021 champions, Ali Tareen officially announced his departure from the Multan Sultans franchise. After failing to reach a renewal agr[...]

The PCB's Interim Strategy

PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi has confirmed that the board will operate the Sultans as an "owner-less" team for the 2026 season. This move is designed to ensure the team's stability whi[...]

"South Punjab is where my heart is. If I come back to PSL, it has to be for the same reason. This year, I’ll be cheering from the stands, but when the team is put up for sale, we[...]"

What’s Next for the Sultans?

While the board manages the business side, the cricket operations will be handled by a specially appointed interim management unit:

  • Management: A professional former cricketer will be appointed to lead operations.
  • Squad: The team remains a powerhouse, led by Mohammad Rizwan, with stars like Usama Mir and Iftikhar Ahmed retained.
  • Sale: A public auction for the franchise is expected to take place in late 2026 or early 2027.
blogPosts.author: Ahmed Khan
